S.FORM: mpitu tmuting mosa cu pwasan briu kisa.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: t’aring tkba biru la, miyuk sali pwasan psba briu, kmayan p’aras gluw maha, tuli! tatuk tunux.
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: hopa hngiyan myan maha, psba biru lokah su.
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: t’aring tkba biru lga, sba’an cami nya psba biru biru lpgan na ke atayan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the atayan language of numbers.

S.FORM: mlu cami psba biru lmpu, m’was cami ’was na biru lpgan.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: waya mu ba’un piyux ci ke atayan.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many atayan languages.

S.FORM: mosa cu m’was biru utux utux rayx, tkba cu ke atayan utux utux ryax, aki pungan yaya mu.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the atayan language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: lalu mu ga Piho.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Piho。
My name is Piho.

S.FORM: lalu yaba mu ga Wilang.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Wilang。
My dad’s name is Wilang.

S.FORM: lalu yaya mu ga Yabung.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Yabung。
My mother’s name is Yabung.

S.FORM: mpu kawas mu micu.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: kyan utux suyan mu likuy, Takun lalu nya, mpu utux kawas nya.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Takun，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Takun, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: ms’un cami m’was biru utux pwasan biru.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: kinang ru suyan mu likuy ga sli cami m’was kwara.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: sli cu mosa mlngya, mhngaw m’was lga, mosa myan mlngya utux sali myan.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: sli cu slpyung, thoyay cami mosa m’was ru mlngya.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡交朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: la’i cu nya Tayal.
S.TRANSL: 我是泰雅族的小孩。
I am an Tayal child.

S.FORM: cyu maki Pyahaw sali myan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在比雅毫。
Our family lives in Pyahaw.

S.FORM: magan he kwara sali myan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tugan mtswe utux sali myan.
S.TRANSL: 我們一家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: mlu cu yaba, yaya, suyan likuy ru suyan nerin maki sali.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: bawi ci yaba mu, yaba mu ga kesacu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: mhekang ci yaya mu, yaya mu ga phgup mga’ing.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: maki cami sali ga, pkayan cami ke Tayal yaba mu.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

S.FORM: mhngi m’was biru ’bagan ga mosa cami alang rgyax.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: kinang ru suyan mu ga ms’un cami kmiyak takay.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: sli mu ci kwara utux sali mu.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: cami yaya mu mosa mtisan kisa.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: sasan ga mwasi kayan nya, ini skinut ru ini kilux kayan nya, sbehuy ci behuy nya.
S.TRANSL: 早上的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: mani cami pang maki babaw uraw k’man, cbung wagi he myan, hlhun calay.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: ’lyan lga, mtalah kayan la.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: kyalun mu yaya, ca mtalah kayan nya?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的？
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: kmayan yaya maha, ini ga mosa mwah hopa behuy la.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: ungat yulung nya gbyan, mhtu bengah la.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: mosa cami sali uyi la.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: maki tu’i sali ga, mkura cu bengah turing cmyus kmayan.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: aki iyat mwah hopa behuy, smoya cu mosa mtisan tanux loyi.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: pwasan biru ga cyu maki syaw sali myan, utux utux ryax ga khani cu mosa m’was biru, khani cu mwah sali uyi.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ini hopa pwasan biru myan, ini piyux ci nyu m’was biru, mkba myan kwara.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: kwara la’i cikuy msli beh unroba, s’un mahi boru, s’un mtisan.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: mlu cami mtisan kwara psba biru uyi, pwasan biru ga yani utux hopa sali.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: utux utux ryax kmagaw cami, le’un myan kmagaw sali pwasan.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: kruma ga cyu cmong tobung, kruma ga cyu kmagaw uraw.
S.TRANSL: 有些人在擦窗戶，有些人在掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: kwara ung na pwasan biru ga halan myan kmagaw uyi, psyugun myan mtiyaw kwara, utux utux ryax ga cmyax ci pwasan biru.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: mnwah cu alang mita uba mu hesa.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: bsya ci ini cami pkita la, lungun mu ci heya.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: mita kinang uba mu ga, kni’an cu nya sikwa, pgubun cu nya ocya.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: cbing ci sikwa mnuhi uba mu, ble calay ni’un.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: sli mu ocya uba mu, ble ci gubun uyi.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: tehok cka wagi lga, cami uya mu s’un myan phapuy ni’un kryaxan.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: piyux ci nhapuy nya kryaxan uya mu, kyan ’cyux, welung, kabang ru musi.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、雞、南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: masu mani kryaxan lga, mosa cami hmbyat rami beh pmahan rami.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: uya mu ga bi’an cu nya piyux ci ngahi, cehuy ru inu, p’aras cu nya mosa sali.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶給我很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: sgayun mu naha, kyalun mu maha mwah caku mita naha loyi.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: rasun cami nya psba biru mosa libu ksinu kisa, nyu cami pnaga tu’i bayi kipu beh blihun.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: miyuk libu ksinu lga, kmayan psba biru maha, gleng ga ubuy gluw piyit, suruw ga ubuy gluw m’u, usa nanak mita kwara.
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: mngungu caku m’u, nanu yaca iyat cu kita m’u.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: piyux ci piyit waya mu texan, cyu mlaka babaw khoni, ru texan mu cyu m’abi bling khoni puk haca.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: cka libu ksinu ga kyan zo, oma ru klit, iyat mu nita kwara ksinu hani, m’es ci lungan waya mu texan soni.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: piyux ci waya mu galun syasing, ptexan mu yaba yaya mu.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: babaw nya ga pglu caku yaba yaya mu mwah loyi.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: mhngi rayx hani ga, cami suyan mu nerin mosa myan Tayto mita mama mu.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: aring myan Bnka mlu kisya mosa Tayto.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: tehok Tayto lga, maras toruy mama mu wahan cami nya magan beh eki.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔會開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: eki ga ini theya naha sali mama mu, maras toruy lga helaw ci tehok la.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: lingay sali mama mu ga kyan utux hopa ci uraw k’man, mlu cami zitensya mosa beh uraw k’man haca.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: maki beh uraw k’man haca ga, rasun cami nya mama mu mosa sm’an mit ru mlu oma.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: tehok gbyan lga, mlu cami mosa mani beh ni’an maci.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: maci haca ga piyux ci toruy nya, nanu yaca ku mlu cami otobay mosa kya.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: shri cami lga, waya naha kri’un otobay mama mu la, siy cami pgluw basu mosa sali.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，叔叔的摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車回家。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: nyu cami tehok Bnka la, ini ba’i waya naha lun otobay mama mu lga.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: la’i cikuy cu ga maki Pyahaw sali myan, m’was biru lga, mosa cami maki Rato, siy cami aki b’nux maci la.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在碧候，上學以後，就搬到了羅東，一直就住在都市裡了。
When we were young, our family lived in Pyahaw. After I started school, we moved to Luodong and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: m’was cu hopa pwasan biru lga, mnwah cu tkba utux ppwasan na gaga knxan atayan, aring kya waya mu ba’un atayan na Taywan ga piyux ci ini ptna ku gaga knxan naha.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: nanu yaca ku kawas mhngi m’was ’bagan hani ga, cami suyan mu likuy mwah myan alang mita bkis, smoya myan tkba gaga knxan myan nanak.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: mbkis ga mhenas spat pgan kawas la, ana ga yani ci tiyu pgan kawas texan.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像六十歲。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: kyalun mu heya maha pisa ke ba’un nya kmayan, hyuci ci kmayan ke Tayal, kba kmayan ke Truku, ke Tewan ru ke Nipun.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的泰雅語很流利，也會說太魯閣語、閩南話和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Tayal, as well as Truku, Hokkien and Japanese.

S.FORM: suruw nya ga waya mu ba’un, aring la’i cikuy lga tkba ke Nipun, nerin nya ga Truku, maki beh ptyawan nya ga piyux ba’un nya c’oli Tewan, nanu yaca ku piyux ke ba’un nya kmayan.
S.TRANSL: 後來我才知道，他從小時候就學日本話，太太是太魯閣族人，他在工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Truku, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: trang cami pkkayan naga, piyux ci yaw waya skayan na bkis, yaw nku knba’an mluyak na bnkesan.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於祖先的狩獵傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: ana myan ini ba’i mung kwara, ana ga waya myan galun syasing rengwa ’ba, mosa myan le’un mung loyi.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: la’i cu cikuy ga ini mu ba’i gaga knxan mu nanak, cayux mu ci kinang ga atayan.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: piyux waya mu ba’un lga, kinang ga la’i na Tayal, mnanak ta ci, p’asun ci ru strahu ta ci.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，自己身為泰雅子孫，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Tayal is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: ’lyan kisa ga, mosa mwah sali sswe mu likuy la.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: cami uya mu ga mosa myan bbisan rami bayi welung, lama myan tmahok ble ni’un gbyan wahan mani sswe mu likuy.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐等弟弟回來吃。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: mhenas myan bisan rami ga, babaw bisan rami ga piyux ci rami nhbyat micu.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤上有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: bayi cami kanrang, warang ru kmi.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了甘藍菜、蕃茄和大黃瓜。
We bought Kale, Tomatoes and Cucumbers.

S.FORM: kmayan tbayi bisan bbway haca maha, cbing ci ongray ru yimux mu, bayi cikah!
S.TRANSL: 水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜，買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: bayi myan ongray ru yimux.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: mhenas myan bisan syang ga, kmayan tbayi maha, lalu bisun su? hopa ru msyang ci welung nya soni, utux ga tugan kbhun pila.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: knita na uya mu ga hmet ci la, kyalun nya tbayi maha hmway cikah.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: ana ga kmayan tbayi haca maha waya hmway ci la, iyat mu hetun pila la.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: kmayan tbayi cyu maki syaw haca maha, uwah bayi ’cyux mu, hopa ru hmway ci ’cyux mu.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: puting ci ga waya myan bayi welung ru ’cyux, tehok sali lga utux hanray ni’an rrami waya myan puyun.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: bsya ci mnaga cami, memaw mku’ung kayan la.
S.TRANSL: 我們等了好久，天都已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: mwah rengwa sswe likuy maha, nyu siy tbah ini hngaw hetay la, babaw ’nyan hngawan ryax ga yaca thoyay cu mwah sali.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: kmayan uya mu maha piyux ci tnahok ta rrami la, sgiy kwara c’oli uwah s’un mani.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多菜，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: tpihun myan glu ru llpyung, uwah ms’un mani piyux ci nni’un na kgabi hani.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: kyan utux gluw m’was biru mu ga Hayung, heya ga ryax ryax mungi maras y’aya nya.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Hayung，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Hayung, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: tkba biru cami ga, ksiyu kryax gluw m’was biru bbrwan, ccong ini ga bbiru lban.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他常跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: te utux, te sa’ing, te tugan ga, syugan naha heya kwara.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: ana ga kyan utux ya’eh scu nya, ksiyu y’aya naha lga ini nya wahiy matu kryax.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: suruw nya lga ini naha ksyugiy y’aya naha la.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: kyan utux ryax, mlu cami mosa mtisan kwara myan.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: maki tu’i ga, smoya mosa stanux Hayung haca, ana ga waya mungi maras lban ccong nya.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Hayung想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Hayung wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: heya ga aki cyu smoya ksiyu lban ccong gluw m’was biru, ana ga kmayan kwara naha maha, ini cami aras uyi.
S.TRANSL: 他想跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我們也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: memaw sktan ci ru ngilis Hayung haca. ms’ang kmayan heya maha, ca cu nya ini ksyugiy lban ccong kwara naha!
S.TRANSL: Hayung急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!
Hayung burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: gluw m’was biru ga kyalun nya heya maha, baha mcwa ini su aras nanak, ini ga ksiyu su y’aya naha lga, ini su wahiy matu la.
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: kcuxan nya ga mwah m’was biru, mgebu ci mwah pwasan briu Hayung haca, kwara knsyugan nya y’aya ga waya nya halan matu gluw m’was biru kwara.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Hayung很早就到學校了，Hayung把全部所借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Hayung arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: mkura gluw m’was biru tmatuk tunux Hayung haca, kmayan maha babaw nya ga p’aras cu nanak y’aya mu, shway nya kwara gluw m’was biru waya smwa’ing ksiyu heya kwara y’aya naha lela.
S.TRANSL: Hayung向同學們道歉，並說以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Hayung apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: yaba mu ga mlikuy mluyak alang myan.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: la’i cikuy cu ga, yaba ru mama mu mhtu tanux gbyan kryax, maras lalaw ru patus.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔常在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: cmyax kayan sasan lga, panga ksinu bnu naha mwah sali.
S.TRANSL: 早上天亮時，他們會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: kruma ga biyak kahung, kruma ga yapit, kruma uyi ga p’oreh.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: naha ga maki pkiyuk alang lga ksyugun naha kwara ksinu, halan naha m’asu c’oli.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: mkebu caku yaba mu kryax, smoya cu mlu yaba mu mosa mluyak.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: kmayan yaba mu maha naga hopa kawas mu lga rasun cu nya mosa mlu.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: mlikuy alang myan ga kba cmi t’oya kmiyak ksinu uyi, naha haca ga kba cmi tlnga ru rangay.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: yaba mu ga kba ci kle tlnga, kmayan yaba mu maha, kwani ga pkiyak ta p’oreh, le’un ta mita rapan na ksinu, t’oya ga pcyan ta babaw tu’i nwahan na ksinu.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: smoya cu aki helaw hayi mlu kwara bkis mosa mluyak, tkba cu cmi t’oya kryax, t’oya mu ga helaw ci waya ciri calay ksinu.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我常常練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱真的抓到獵物。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: texan cu nya yaba mu lga kyalun cu nya maha, babaw nya ga mosa su kba calay mluyak.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說，以後我一定很會打獵。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: hopa kawas mu micu la, panga cu bhoni ru pnelu maku, mlu cu yaba mu mosa mluyak.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: mwah cami alang myan lga ksyugun myan pnanga ksinu, syugun myan kwara c’oli.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: kmayan yaba mu maha, shway ta nhway bne’an na lutux bnkesan, thoyay ta mluyak piyux ci ksinu.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: msu’i cu mosa m’was biru sasan la.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: mosa cu pwasan biru ga, yngyan mu maras kabang la.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: ini cu aras ana nanu.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: m’was biru ga, ms’un cu gluw m’was biru mita biru ppwasun.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: pcpung miru ga, syugan cu nya bbrwan ru ccong nku gluw m’was biru.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: kyalun cu nya psba biru maha, “babaw nya ga helaw hayi mtuli, iya ksu’i la!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: myasa ci lpyung mu ga Yukan, heya ga la’i Tayan uyi.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Yukan，他也是泰雅族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Yukan, and he is also an Tayal child.

S.FORM: ms’un cami m’was biru beh alang Pyahaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在碧候部落讀書。
We study together in the Pyahaw. tribe.

S.FORM: ms’un cami mung bkis kmayan yaw lela, kba cami calay kmayan ke Tayan.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說泰雅語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

S.FORM: bawi caku ci ru thuy caku ci, Yukan ga, creh ci ru mhekang ci.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Yukan很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Yukan is short and thin.

S.FORM: Yukan ga shelaw calay, sli naha ci kwara.
S.TRANSL: Yukan很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Yukan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: soni ga unrokay na pwasan biru, piyux ci pcpung nya waya crxun nku pwasan biru.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: kyan mholuy snyu, kmkah boru, mt’enah, myugi ru cmu pnelu.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: kinang ga pcpung cu mt’enah.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: trang t’enah caku ga, wa caku takuy la, piyux ci smuyux nya tari mu.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: ana ga mtuli caku, mkura cu gleng mt’enah loyi.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: tehok cu pcingan lga m’es kwara c’oli.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ana cu ini agan te utux cnrxan ga, m’es caku calay, baha mcwa waya caku thoyay tmasu pcpung la.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: mnluw cu yaba mu mnwah mita mama mu hesa.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: wa m’ilis kakay mama mu la.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: kyalun cami nya, cyu bling lmu’i na sali.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: kble lmu’i heya ga, waya kahun babaw lmu’i shotaw.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: yaba mu maras he kacing ru binro sbe nya mama mu.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: cami mama mu mtisan myan cka sali, piyux ci yaw lela waya nya skayan.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: gleng shri cu ga, strahu cu nya mama mu maha wa caku mbawi la ru waya cu mllaw hayi la.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: kmayan cu maha, “naga ble kakay na mama lga, babaw nya uwah tisan sali myan uyi.”
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: maki te sa’ing seng pusan sa’ing kawas ga, sexu pklahang ku splawa naha lnhoyan na pkkayan yaw nku lalu mibunsyo tayan ga ana mosa sbiru lalu tayan nanak.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: nwahan mu mita Nolay Piho mlikuy na alang tayan, heya ga bsya calay mskura nya sexu pklahang ru msina sku mibunsyo ta ga aki nanak lalu tayan sbiru ta.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了的部落青年Nolay Piho，他長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」。
I interviewed Nolay Piho, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: pkayan cami ’nyan hngawan ryax hani ga mosa cu mita sali nya.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: maki sku pkayan myan ga, sba’an cu nya kahun inu lalu nya, spkita cu nya utux sali nya ru alang nya uyi.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: kyalun mu heya maha ca utux ci lungan su mosa p’iyu lalu, ya’eh su pbiru na lela heya ga?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: kyalun cu nya maha, baha mcwa sbiru ta ke ckoku ga ini ba’i kmayan lalu nya, kruma c’oli ga No先生 san nya, piyux calay mhtu psya’an na ke.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \No Xian Sheng

S.FORM: kmayan Nolay Piho maha, “sbiru ta ke Tayal lalu ta ga yaca ga calay ci lalu ta, lalu ta ga tgiwan na gluw ta Tayal, gluw utux sali, ru cnrxan ta, aki piyux hayi gluw tayan ga mosa naha llwan lalu naha nanak.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Nolay Piho said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: cami uya ga mnwah myan tbayi rrami beh bbisan rami hesa, mnaras nya nanak nuhi nya rami mosa, kble myasa ni’un na nni’un tayan ru spkani nya kwara c’oli.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: kwara c’oli ga sli naha ci bbisan na uya, piyux calay c’oli bayi ali ruma ru cryuhing, piyux ci c’oli mwah tmalam mani tnahok nya nni’un.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，桂竹筍和山蘇很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: tnahok nya cryuhing ru sumun ga ble ci ni’un, kyan loyi tnahok nya m’aw tmagun syang biyak kahung, ble sokan nya ga tmapeh piyux ci llpyung, mwah m’otu bbisan myan kwara.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的山蘇和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The Shansu and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: trang tmahok nni’un nku uya n_ga, maki cu beh syaw nya tmapeh llpyung. lokah cu smuy beh syaw nya maha, “rrami ga nuhi nanak, mrkyas nanak ungat iyu, nahay uwah bayi ow!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: kwara tbisun myan ga helaw ci waya su’un tbayi kwara, kmayan uya maha, “ulung isu mwah rmaw kwara.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: kahun ku lnhoyan hani ga, piyux ci waya mu kba’un nku knba’an na k’man tayan ru nni’un tayan, waya mu kba’un uyi ku kn’wix na tbayi bbisan.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: texan mu uya ga cmi ci lungan nni’un tayan, strahu mu calay ru p’asun maku.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
